title: Ex-British shooting champion Alfie Oldring survives being blasted in the stomach by friend | London Evening Standard
text:
Thursday 23 February 2017 10:46 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Former British shooting champion Alfie Oldring, pictured, was left fighting for his life after the accident. FieldsportsChannel.tv (YouTube) 
A former British shooting champion escaped death by a whisker after a friend accidentally shot him in the stomach. 
Alfie Oldring was left fighting for his life after being blasted in the horrific shotgun accident while out on a clay pigeon shoot. 
Doctors carried out emergency surgery to remove 50 pellets from Mr Oldring's stomach and kept him in intensive care in a bid to save his life. 
Mr Oldring, who was a member of the England and Great Britain shooting teams and competed in European championships and the Commonwealth Games, said it felt “just like being hit with a sledgehammer” when the accident happened in a hide on a shooting range in Hampshire . British champion skeet shooter Alfie Oldring, who was injured in a shotgun accident. (FieldsportsChannel.tv) 
Mr Oldring, whose first name is Paul but is known as Alfie, shared his story with Fieldsports Channel TV in a YouTube video showing his gruesome injuries and remarkable recovery. 
“It’s just like being hit with a sledgehammer,” he said. “No searing pain just a really dull ache. 
“It really just wasn’t my day to die, that’s all you can say. 
“The shot was inch perfect not to killing me. 

“Had I died, he [Mr Oldring’s friend] would have been arrested for attempted murder until such time as the forensic boys would have been able to prove it was an accident.” 
Former British champion Mr Oldring has shot Olympic skeet for over 40 years including for England and Great Britain. In the past he has ranked one of the top 10 Olympic skeet shooters in the world. Aftermath: Mr Oldring has since recovered from the shotgun accident. (FieldsportsChannel.tv)
